website_summaries.verdict: As an alternative to Intel's built-in Wireless Display, the Asus WiCast is both easy to use and works on nearly any laptop--but it's also cumbersome and includes some DRM limitations.
pros: works on any laptop (or other HDMI-enabled source)
cons: Blu-ray streaming requires you to turn off the laptop display

customer_reviews.title: User friendly
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this product. Easy to setup and very easy to use. Quality of wireless picture transfer and online movie streaming is excellent! I would have rated it at the highest level, but nothing is perfect except one... Would recommend and would buy for someone eles as a gift. FYI: Only setback is your computer and your TV must have an HDMI connection. My old laptop has only the AV connection and my TV does not. So this is not a problem with this product just my equipment.
customer_reviews.author: kat

customer_reviews.title: Very limited range
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped that this product could be used to tie two tv's to one cable box so that the sound etc would coordinate between two rooms, and without the need to run long HDMI cables. The problem is that the unit has very limited range. Reception really needs line-of-sight installation as going through a wall greatly reduced performance,even when the receiver and transmitter were within 10 feet of each other. When working within the distance limitations, however, the unit does work well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine for me
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so this is my first review on here and I have to say this thing works really good. I have XMBC on my home pc with a extra drive for all my media. I had been thinking of just building a machine to be just a media server but found this. My computer sits across the room from my TV (15 feet) and it has good transfer and sync on HD/1080P video. My only complaint which may just be my video card is if I leave the transmitter hooked up my screen goes black every few minutes for about 3 seconds and also the sound on my computer will not work with the HDMI plugged into the transmitter.
customer_reviews.author: Crash

customer_reviews.title: Brutally Bad Range
customer_reviews.text: As opposed to the specifications listed with this wireless transmitter/receiver, in my TV room with direct line of sight and no known sources of interference, this unit only had a 3-4 FOOT range!! If the transmitter and receiver were any further apart, the transmission lock (as indicated by the solid white light on the units) would not occur and no picture was transmitted. I found it absolutely useless and am promptly returning it. Unless you can live with the transmitter and receiver being virtually next to each other, I suggest you look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: PaulC

customer_reviews.title: A great HDMI WiFi
customer_reviews.text: I've been waiting for a product like this for 2 years. It works really well. I have the transmitter in the office and the receiver 25' away in the living room. A wall separates the 2 rooms. I have had no problems with it. Also when I have the receiver in the bed room 33' away (more walls) it works just as good. The only problem that I have experienced is that when the receiver has no power, the PC (I have an iMac 2.66GHz) the mouse and screen has slow moments. Also the receiver fan is noticeable. Not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: DreNYC

customer_reviews.title: Good but at short range...
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good product, it does what it say in the box but could not get it to work beyond 3.5m which is annoying... Otherwise plug & play and everything works without having to do anything manually which is great! If ASUS can get the distance sorted it will be the ideal product! Maybe one day they will combine it with a wireles RF in order to use it with HD set-top boxes and have the ability to change channels without having a separate RF cable.
customer_reviews.author: Kostas (London)

customer_reviews.title: Wireless HDMI
customer_reviews.text: Works great like expected. I would recommend this to anyone looking to get rid of wires from floor to ceiling. Used a smart powerstrip in the attic so the receiver is only on when the projector is powered up.
customer_reviews.author: aadavidallen

customer_reviews.title: Finally, 1080p Wireless!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product streams seamlessly. Only problem was that the system needed the line of sight to function well but I can live with that! Friends and family want one now!
customer_reviews.author: Poppy J

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This device works great. I have the transmitter about 12 feet from my TV and the picture quality when transmitting a video has been as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: works as described... no lag what so ever. Only problem we have is losing diplay settings on pc when you turn off TV. (using tv as 3rd display monitor)... must reconfigure display settings everytime we shut it off and turn it back on.
customer_reviews.author: Bweg

customer_reviews.title: Range is very limited
customer_reviews.text: Had to ship this back to Amazon, I have a ceiling mount projector and was planning on using this and drop the HDMI wire. Unfortunately after hours of attempting experiments, I had a hard time establishing any kind of signal consistently unless the transmitter and receiver are withing 6 feet line of sight of each other. Tried resolution 720p, 1080i and 1080p but no luck in any cases. I had carefully read comments and feedback from other folks who have reviewed this product to ensure a good distance is supported. Wondering if there is some digital noise in my area since others do not seem to have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: VR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what we need
customer_reviews.text: We watch online streaming program a lot and this wireless transmitter worked perfect, easy to install and easy to accompany with our laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good job, ASUS
customer_reviews.text: Very good, perfect and crystal quality and no latency, but signal can't goes thru fat, main walls. Also sadly, that reciever can't be powered by usb, only by adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Goshil

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because my television sits on my mantle over my fireplace. In an effort to avoid running cable through the wall/under the floor/ through the attic, I opted to purchase this instead. I have to say I've had it for about 2 months now, and I am very impressed. The picture is clear, and everything works with no noticeable latency, which is important when I'm playing my PS3. Everyone is impressed that all my media is hidden in my closet and my TV sits above my mantle with no ugly cabling.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Ervin

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't get 2 to work properly
customer_reviews.text: After I couldn't get the first unit to connect, I returned it and ordered a second one. The picture was great but didn't last. When switching back and forth between 480 and 1080i (because not all channels are HD) the pictue became completely unwatchable. Since I already learned from the first unit that there is hardly any support, I returned the sucker for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Great product even if you don't need it
customer_reviews.text: This technology is insane. I plugged the cable from the bigger unit into my TV, the cable from the smaller unit (both units are quite small) into my laptop, and suddenly -- without me installing stuff or pressing any keys or doing anything whatsoever -- my laptop screen was replicated on the TV, pixel for pixel, with NO latency. This is in sharp contrast to many other video signal transmitters that change the resolution and/or quality and/or introduce compression artifacts and are slow. Granted the laptop manufacturer and Microsoft for its Windows 7 and HD standards people also deserve credit, but this is mind blowing.
customer_reviews.author: D. Magdic

customer_reviews.title: ASUS HD Xmtr & Rcvr
customer_reviews.text: This product did not function as advertised. The receiver would not lock into the xmtr signal even when the units were side by side. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jpf

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This product is a piece of junk. I tried it with the transmiter located right beside of the receiver and it did not work. 10 feet, 20 feet etc. It works intermintantly but is very sketchy at best. I would recomend spending a little more money to get something with better reviews.
customer_reviews.author: sgtdaryl

customer_reviews.title: Quality is good
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of this little unit. It is easy and intuitive to use but the only thing I would like to see is the option to add multiple receivers. The range is not great once the box is out of line of sight but I would still like to be able to run multiple tv's from the same box.
customer_reviews.author: Carl R. Montrosse Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to transmit from my cable box in my living room to the tv in my bedroom. The distance is about 20 feet through 1 wall. I have been using for a week now and I have no complaints. When using the tv in the bedroom(the one being transmitted to) I use my phone to control the cable box so i don't need to worry about an IR transmitter or even remembering to carry the remote upstairs. For me this is working great and I think for over a short distance you can't get much better than this item.
customer_reviews.author: MFavGal

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for a little while but eventually just stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: Worked when it works but then it just stopped working. Now the tx and rx units connection light just flashes forever and never connects.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Yuan-Vogel

product_meta.title: ASUS WiCast EW2000 Wireless HD Video Transmitter and Receiver
product_meta.description:
Stream HD content wirelessly through Wireless Home DIgital Interface. Full 1080p HD video wireless playback. Up to 8 channel audio playback. Less than 1ms latency for seamless, stutter-free playback. Wireless Home Digital Interface Technology is the only standard that enables uncompressed Full HD video and audio streaming without wires. 3Gb/s data transfer speed. Wireless Blu-ray playback

AMAZON.COM
Stream HD, Wirelessly 

ASUS WiCast transforms your PC into a wireless media center. Using the latest Wireless Home Digital Interface (WHDI) Technology, easily connect, stream, and enjoy picture-perfect Full HD visuals and high-quality audio streaming from your PC to a compatible HDTV or other external display. Setup is streamlined so you can power the WiCast transmitter with just your PC's USB ports. Its small, compact design makes it a nice fit to any home or meeting room environment. And with up to 3Gb/s transfer rate, ASUS WiCast can stream any content with up to Full HD quality, less than 1 ms latency, and up to 8 channel audio playback. 


KEY FEATURES
 * Full 1080p HD video wireless playback with up to 1920 x 1080 resolution for pristine HD quality visuals (Learn more)
 * Up to 8 channel audio playback delivers incredible detail and surround sound support (Learn more)
 * 1ms latency for seamless, stutter-free playback 
 * Wireless Home Digital Interface Technology is the only standard that enables uncompressed Full HD video and audio streaming without wires (Learn more)
 * 3Gb/s data transfer speed for reliable, smooth Full 1080p HD media playback (Learn more)
 * Wireless Blu-ray playback to enjoy your favorite movies in Full HD quality (Learn more)
 * Plug and play setup lets you connect and stream without complicated wires (Learn more)



LEARN MORE
AT HOME MULTIMEDIA HD ENJOYMENT

View larger ASUS WiCast EW2000 allows you to wirelessly stream content from your PC to your display in Full HD quality. And with up 8 channel audio support, enjoy immersive surround sound experience on a wirelessly connected HDTV or monitor with speakers. It also supports devices including Blu-ray and DVD players, set-top box, PS3, and XBOX gaming consoles. 

WiCast has an ultra fast 3Gb/s transfer speed and less than 1ms latency to flawlessly support games and HD movies, so you can enjoy anything from your favorite first person shooter game to the latest blockbuster without compromising quality. Plus, its small, compact size makes it easy to move around from room to room. 


SECURE CONFERENCE ROOM PRESENTATIONS

View larger ASUS WiCast EW2000 features Wireless Home Digital Interface (WHDI) Technology that allows you to connect PCs wirelessly to a projector in conference rooms for multimedia presentations with a range of up to 33 feet. Plus, its transmitter and receiver setup is made simple so you can quickly connect without complicated wires – simply plug and play. 


WHAT'S IN THE BOX
 * ASUS WiCast Transmitter: 1 HDMI Cable, 1 mini USB Cable, 1 Adapter
 * ASUS WiCast Receiver: 1 HDMI Cable, 1 Adapter
 * Travel Pouch 
 * Warranty Card 
 * Manual 


SPECIFICATIONS
 * Interface: HDMI 
 * Video: Up to 1080p 60Hz, under 1 ms latency
 * Audio: Up to 8 channels
 * Wireless HDMI Technology: Wireless Home Digital Interface (WHDI) v1.4 
 * Transmission Distance: Up to 33 feet
 * Operation Frequency: 5.15 ~ 5.85 GHz
 * Data Rate: 3Gb/s
 * Power Supply: Transmitter: 5V, 2A 10W Adapter (if USB power is not available) Receiver: 5V, 2A 10W Adapter
 * Power Consumption: Transmitter: 4.75W (powered by USB), Receiver: 10W
 * Input / Output: Transmitter: 1 x HDMI port, 1 x Mini USB, 1 x DC in, Receiver: 1 x HDMI port ,1 x DC in
 * Accessories: Transmitter: 1 x mini USB Cable, 1 x HDMI Cable , 1 x Adapter, Receiver: 1 x HDMI Cable, 1x Adapter
 * Weight: Transmitter: 0.242 lb., Receiver: 0.352 lb.
 * Color: Black
 * Dimensions: Transmitter: 4.05 inches, (L) x 2.67 inches (W) x 1.12 inches (H), Receiver: 4.13 inches (L) x 0.98 inches (W) x 4.9 inches (H) 



© 2010 ASUS Computer International. All Rights Reserved. ASUS is a registered trademark of ASUSTeK Computer. All specifications are subject to change without notice and features are only in select models. Products may not be available in all markets. Brand and product names mentioned are trademarks of their respective companies. ASUS shall not be liable for technical or editorial errors or omissions contained herein. ASUS WiCast transmission speed may vary on system specification and location. 

Check Out Other Great ASUS Products

ASUS 27" LCD Monitor (MT276HE) 
Enjoy the glory of Full HD with the ASUS 27" MT276HE LCD monitor. With a wide variety of inputs and also HDMI ports, it is the perfect monitor for watching movies or playing the latest games in 1080p. It also makes for a great pairing with the ASUS WiCast kit. 
ASUS EeeBox PC EB1501P 
This tiny yet powerful HTPC makes for a perfect pairing with the WiCast in giving you a streamlined and clutter-free home theater setup. 
ASUS B53J Business Notebook
Seriously durable and meant for business. The new ASUS B series notebooks cater to every business' needs by providing top notch reliability, build-quality, security and various convenient features. Make a splash in your presentations with the WiCast and the B53J notebook. 
ASUS Skype Video Phone Touch SV1TS 
A truly revolutionary technology, the ASUS Skype Video Phone Touch allows you to make unlimited video Skype calls at a touch without a computer or additional hardware or software.
